vague_description: Finding the most accurate straight line that minimizes the greatest difference between predicted and observed values.
detailed_description: Fit the ‘best’ straight line y = bx + a where the objective is to minimize the maximum deviation of all the \param{K} observed values of \param{Y} from the value predicted by the linear relationship. The observed values of y are given by \param{Y} and the observed values of x are given by \param{X}.
target_objective: Minimize the maximum deviation of all K observed values from the predicted y values
target_constraints: The deviation is the absolute difference between predicted y values and observed y values
Deviation should be minimized for all K observed values
